entry.name: pres
entry.description: Commonly used for atmospheric pressure, the pressure exerted by the atmosphere as a consequence of gravitational attraction exerted upon the "column" of air lying directly above the point in question.

entry.name: pres_reduced
entry.description: The conversion of an observed pressure value to the value it would theortically have at mean sea level.

entry.name: pres_tend
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: icao_std_atmos
entry.description: A hypothetical vertical distribution of atmospheric tmeperature, pressure, and density that, by internation agreement, is taken to be representative of the atmosphere. (AMS glossary)

entry.name: geop
entry.description: The potential energy of a unit mass relative to sea level, numerically equal to the work that would be done in lifting the unit mass from sea level to the height at which the mass is located. (AMS glossary)

entry.name: geop_ht
entry.description: The height of a given point in the atmosphere in units proportional to the potential energy of unit mas (geopotential) at this height relative to sea level.

entry.name: height
entry.description: The geometric height of layer or surface.

entry.name: ht_std_dev
entry.description: no description available.

entry.name: total_ozone
entry.description: The total quantity of ozone integrated in a column from the top of the atmosphere to the surface.

entry.name: air_temp
entry.description: The degree of hotness or coldness measured against a definite scale, in this case for the atmosphere.

entry.name: virt_air_temp
entry.description: Temperature that dry air would have if its pressure and density were equal to those of a given sample of moist air.

entry.name: ptnl_temp
entry.description: The temperature an unsaturated parcel of dry air would have if brought adiabatically and reversibly from its initial state to a standard pressure.

entry.name: eq_ptnl_temp
entry.description: A thermodynamic quantity, with its natural logarithm proportional to the entropy of moist air, that is conserved in a reversible moist adiabatic process. (AMS Glossary)

entry.name: max_air_temp
entry.description: The greatest air temperature in a given period of time.

entry.name: min_air_temp
entry.description: The lowest air temperature in a given period of time.

entry.name: dwpt_temp
entry.description: The temperature to which a given parcel of air must be cooled at constant pressure and water vapor content in order for saturation to occur.

entry.name: dwpt_dprs
entry.description: The quantity of difference between the air temperature and the dewpoint temperature.

entry.name: temp_lapse_rate
entry.description: The decrease of atmospheric temperature with height.

entry.name: visib
entry.description: The greatest distance in which it is just possible to see and identify with the unaided eye 1) in the daytime, a prominent dark object against the sky at the horizon, and 2) at night, a known, preferably unfocused, moderately intense light source.

entry.name: rad_spect_one
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: rad_spect_two
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: rad_spect_three
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: prcl_lift_indx
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: temp_anom
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: pres_anom
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: temp_dif
entry.description: The difference between the standard atmosphere temperature (day) at a level and the measured air temperature at the same level.

entry.name: wav_spectra1
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: wav_spectra2
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: wav_spectra3
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: wnd_dir
entry.description: The angle, measured in a clockwise direction, between true north and the direction from which the wind is blowing.

entry.name: wnd_spd
entry.description: The ratio of the distance covered by the air to the time taken to cover it.

entry.name: wnd_ucmp
entry.description: The east-west component of the wind which is relative to the east-west axis of the grid. (This is true east for spherical and mercator but not for lambert conformal and others.)

entry.name: wnd_vcmp
entry.description: The north-south componenet of the wind which is relative to the north-south axis of the grid. (This is true east for spherical and mercator but not for lambert conformal and others.)

entry.name: strm_func
entry.description: The stream function of the geostrophic wind on a constant-pressure surface.

entry.name: vel_ptnl
entry.description: A scalar function with its gradient equal to the velocity vector u of an irrotational flow.

entry.name: montg_strm_func
entry.description: The stream function of the geostrophic wind on an isentropic surface.

entry.name: sigma_coord_vert_vel
entry.description: The stream function of the geostrophic wind on an isentropic surface.

entry.name: wnd_vert_vel
entry.description: The estimated vertical rate of movement of air relative to pressure coordinates.

entry.name: wnd_wcmp
entry.description: The estimated vertical rate of movement of air relative to geospatial coordinates.

entry.name: abs_vort
entry.description: The rotation, usually around the vertical axis, of a fluid particle determined with respect to an absolute coordinate system.

entry.name: div
entry.description: The estimated rate of horizontal expansion of the vector wind components, about an absolute refence system.

entry.name: rltv_vort
entry.description: The estimated rate of horizontal expansion of the vector wind components, measured in a system relative to the earth's surface.

entry.name: rel_div
entry.description: The stream function of the geostrophic wind on an isentropic surface.

entry.name: vert_ucmp_shr
entry.description: no defintion available.

entry.name: vert_vcmp_shr
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: curr_dir
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: curr_spd
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: curr_ucmp
entry.description: The west-east (u) motion of an ocean current.

entry.name: curr_vcmp
entry.description: The south-north (v) motion of an ocean current.

entry.name: spec_hum
entry.description: In a system of moist air, the (dimensionless) ratio of the mass of water vapor to the total mass of the system (AMS).

entry.name: rltv_hum
entry.description: The ratio of the vapor pressure to the staturation vapor pressure with respect to water (AMS).

entry.name: mix_ratio
entry.description: The ratio of the mass of water vapor to the mass of dry air.

entry.name: prcp_h2o
entry.description: Total atmospheric water vapor in a vertical column unit cross-sectional area between two levels.

entry.name: vpr_pres
entry.description: The partial pressure of water vapor in the atmosphere.

entry.name: sat_def
entry.description: The measure between the layer of saturation thickness and the actual thickness of a layer.

entry.name: evap
entry.description: The rate of change from liquid water to the gaseous state over a time period.

entry.name: cld_ice
entry.description: Column total of condensed frozen cloud water.

entry.name: rain_rate
entry.description: The measure of the averate rate of rain occurring at a location.

entry.name: tstm_prob
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: ttl_prcp
entry.description: The estimated depth of the precipitation (water equivalent) that is forecast to accumulate in a specified period of time (accumulation period), for all precipitation types and both convective and non-convective. The accumulation period varies over the forecast period (taus). For NOGAPS: the accumulation starts at the base time and every 12 hours the 'bucket' is emptied (a bucket tip) and the accumulation starts again (12, 24, 36, ...). A grid is created at each bucket tip and at three hour intervals between them. The four grids created over one bucket tip period have accumulation periods of 3, 6, 9 and 12 hours. To determine the possible taus for a given accumulation period use taus = A + (n-1)B; where A is the accumulation period, B is the bucket tip, and n is the number grids desired. For COAMPS: the accumulation starts at the base time and is never emptied (infinite bucket tip). Grids are made at one hour intervals with the accumulation period equal to the forecast period (tau).

entry.name: stab_prcp
entry.description: The estimated depth of the precipitation (water equivalent) that accumulated in twelve hours from a non-convective or stable precipitation source. Here the accumulation starts at the base time and every 12 hours the 'bucket' is emptied and the accumulation starts again (0, 12, 24, 36, ...). A grid is created at each bucket tip and at three hour intervals between them. (NOGAPS)

entry.name: conv_prcp
entry.description: The estimated depth of the precipitation (water equivalent) that accumulated in twelve hours from a convective precipitation source. Here the accumulation starts at the base time and every 12 hours the 'bucket' is emptied and the accumulation starts again (0, 12, 24, 36, ...). A grid is created at each bucket tip and at three hour intervals between them. (NOGAPS)

entry.name: snwfl_rt_wtr_eq
entry.description: The estimated snowfall rate in water equivalency.

entry.name: ttl_snow
entry.description: The estimated depth of the snow (water equivalent) that accumulated over a fixed period of time (accumulation period). The accumulation period is the same regardless of the forecast period. (When the accumulation period ends, a snap-shot is taken (grid made), and then the accumulation is set to zero (the bucket tip). The accumulation begins again for the next accumulation period.) The accumulation period and the bucket tip are exactly the same for each grid. Grids are available at forecast hours that are multiples of the accumulation period. One or more accumulation periods should be specified in the request. If no period attribute is specified, the response will contain all grids for each accumulation period for that forecast hour. If period attribute is specified, the response will contain data only if the specified period matches one of the accumulation periods for that forecast hour. For COAMPS, the accumulation period is every 3 hours. For NOGAPS/Ensemble, the accumulation period is every 6 hours.

entry.name: snw_dpth
entry.description: The estimated depth of snow on the ground.

entry.name: pbl_depth
entry.description: 1. (atmosphere) The height of the top of the lowest layer of the troposphere in contact with the earth's surface (often capped by a temperature inversion). 2. (ocean) The mixed layer depth in the ocean.

entry.name: trans_thcln_dpth
entry.description: The depth of the layer of water that varies between the warmer surface zone and the colder deep zone of a thermally stratified body of water. In the thermocline, temperature decreases rapidly with depth.

entry.name: main_thcln_dpth
entry.description: The depth of the layer of water between the warmer surface zone and the colder deep zone of a thermally stratified body of water. In the thermocline, temperature decreases rapidly with depth.

entry.name: main_thcln_anom
entry.description: The depth of changes in the layer of water between the warmer surface zone and the colder deep zone of a thermally stratified body of water. In the thermocline, temperature decreases rapidly with depth.

entry.name: ttl_cld_cvr
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: conv_cld
entry.description: The estimated rate of the sky dome that is covered by convective clouds.

entry.name: low_cld_cvr
entry.description: The estimated percentage of the sky dome that is covered by all low level clouds.

entry.name: mid_cld_cvr
entry.description: The estimated percentage of the sky dome that is covered by all middle level clouds.

entry.name: hi_cld_cvr
entry.description: The estimated percentage of the sky dome that is covered by all high level clouds.

entry.name: cld_wtr
entry.description: Column total of condensed liquid cloud water.

entry.name: bst_lift_indx
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: snw_conv
entry.description: The quantity of snow precipitation that is estimated to occur over a period of time due to a convective precipitation source.

entry.name: snw_lge_scl
entry.description: The total measure of snow expected from a large scale precipitation source.

entry.name: sea_temp
entry.description: The temperature of the water at the ocean surface.

entry.name: land_sea
entry.description: A representation of the earth's surface denoting if a point is land (1) or water (0).

entry.name: dev_sea_lvl_mn
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: roughness_len
entry.description: The height above the displacement plane at which the mean wind becomes zero when extrapolating the logarithmic wind-speed profile downward through the surface layer. (AMS Glossary)

entry.name: albedo
entry.description: The ratio of reflected over incoming flux density.

entry.name: soil_temp
entry.description: The temperature of the soil at a specific depth.

entry.name: veg_covr
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: sal
entry.description: A measure of the quantity of dissolved salts in seawater. (AMS GLOSSARY)

entry.name: dens
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: wtr_roff
entry.description: The quantity of water derived from precipitation that ultimately reaches stream channels.

entry.name: ice_cvrg
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: ice_thkn
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: dir_ice_drft
entry.description: The angle, measured in a clockwise direction, between true north and the direction in which ice has drifted on the water's surface during the previous 12 hours.

entry.name: spd_ice_drft
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: ice_drft_ucmp
entry.description: The estimated rate of movement of the ice in the west-east direction.

entry.name: ice_drft_vcmp
entry.description: The estimated rate of movement of the ice in the south-north direction.

entry.name: ice_grth
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: ice_div
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: snw_melt
entry.description: The estimated melting rate of snow on the ground.

entry.name: sig_wav_ht
entry.description: (ocean wave forecasting) A fictitious wave with a height and period equal to the average height of the highest third of the actual waves that pass a fixed point.

entry.name: wnd_wav_dir
entry.description: The direction of wave spectra which is under the influence of the local wind.

entry.name: wnd_wav_ht
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: wnd_wav_per
entry.description: The mean direction of the frequency wave spectra which is under the influence of the local wind, then take the inverse.

entry.name: swl_wav_dir
entry.description: The direction of waves that are not under the influence of the local wind (swell waves).

entry.name: swl_wav_ht
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: swl_wav_per
entry.description: An averate time interval between successive crests of those waves that are not under the influence of local wind (swell waves).

entry.name: pr_wav_dir
entry.description: The angle measured clockwise from true north to the direction from which the primary waves are coming.

entry.name: pr_wav_per
entry.description: The quantity of time required for two successive primary wave crests to pass a fixed point.

entry.name: scdy_wav_dir
entry.description: The angle measured clockwise from true north to the direction from which secondary waves are coming.

entry.name: scdy_wav_per
entry.description: The quantity of time required for two successive secondary wave crests to pass a fixed point.

entry.name: sol_rad
entry.description: The incoming instantaneous shortwave radiation from the sun.

entry.name: ir_flux
entry.description: Net infrared heat flux

entry.name: net_shtwav_rad_flux_toa
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: net_lngwav_rad_flux_toa
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: lngwav_rad_flux
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: shtwav_rad_flux
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: global_rad_flux
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: bri_temp
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: ltnt_heat_flux
entry.description: The estimated rate of heat flow per unit mass for a system in a reversible, isobaric-isotheric change of phase.

entry.name: snsb_heat_flux
entry.description: The estimated rate of the flow of heat between two bodies.

entry.name: bdy_layer_diss
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: wnd_strs_ucmp
entry.description: The drag force per unit area caused by the wind shear in the u component.

entry.name: wnd_strs_vcmp
entry.description: The drag force per unit area caused by the wind shear in the v component.

entry.name: wnd_mix_energy
entry.description: no definition available.

entry.name: duct_base_ht
entry.description: The electromagnetic duct base (or lower) height.

entry.name: duct_strength
entry.description: The difference between the modified refractivity (M units) at the top of a duct and the trapping layer base height (M max).

entry.name: qstar
entry.description: Represents a potential, positive if surface has more moisture than air layer, negative if air layer has more moisture than surface.

entry.name: tstar
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: grad_mod_refr
entry.description: The gradient of modified refractivity (dm/dz).

entry.name: grnd_sea_temp
entry.description: The temperature of the earth's skin, consisting of the ocean surface and land surface at the bottom of the atmosphere.

entry.name: geop_ht_mn
entry.description: The mean height of points in the atmsophere expressed in units proportional to the geopotential of those heights.

entry.name: cld_base
entry.description: The estimated height, relative to mean sea level, of the lower surface of a cloud layer.

entry.name: cld_top_temp
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: aero_vis_rng
entry.description: The greatest distance in a given direction at which it is just possible to see an object with the unaided eye in platform and target layers.

entry.name: clr_air_turb
entry.description: Scaled Elrod clear air turbulence index.

entry.name: contrail_prbl
entry.description: The contrail formation probability using critical temperature.

entry.name: geop_ht_24hr_dif
entry.description: The change in geopotential height over 24 hours at a given location.

entry.name: dynm_ht
entry.description: The height of a point in the atmosphere expressed in a unit proporation to the geopotential at that point.

entry.name: duct_mexcess
entry.description: The difference between the duct strength (modified refractivity or M units) and the magnitude (M-units) of the layer whose value is obtained from the differenced of the modified refractivity from the trapping layer base height and the value at the duct base height (or the surface in the case of surface-based ducts).

entry.name: duct_thickness
entry.description: The thickness of the electromagnetic duct from the base, which may be at the surface, to the top of the layer.

entry.name: duct_top
entry.description: The height of the top of an electromagnetic duct.

entry.name: gale_wnd_prob
entry.description: The probability of the near surface wind speed being equal to or greater than 34 knots (gale force winds lower boundary).

entry.name: abs_vort_ens_stdev
entry.description: The standard deviation of the absolute vorticity of the ensemble members for a point in time.

entry.name: air_temp_ens_stdev
entry.description: The standard deviation of the air temperature of the ensemble members for a point in time.

entry.name: rltv_hum_ens_stdev
entry.description: The standard deviation of the relative humidity of the ensemble members for a point in time.

entry.name: wcap_prbl
entry.description: The percent of occurrence of white caps forming on the crest of waves due to wind.

entry.name: vrtx_wav
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: wnd_vect_dif_mgtd
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: turb_ke
entry.description: The mean kinetic energy per unit mass associated with eddies in turbulent flow.

entry.name: dust_sfc_concen
entry.description: The mass of dust particles in a cubic meter of air.

entry.name: tot_dust_optdep
entry.description: The optical thickness measured vertically above some given altitude due to the extinction and scattering by dust particles (integrated).

entry.name: tot_dust_concen
entry.description: The estimated total density of particulate matter of dust.

entry.name: cape
entry.description: Maximum buoyant energy that an unstable air parcel can aquire.

entry.name: cin
entry.description: Energy needed to overcome atmospheric stability for continued spontaneous convection.

entry.name: frozen_rain
entry.description: An accumulation of rain that freezes before reaching the ground or transparent or translucent pellets of ice less than or equal to 5mm in diameter. Ice pellets usually bounce when hitting hard ground and make a sound upon impact. These ice pellets can be 1) sleet or grains of ice, generally transparent, globular, solid grains of ice that have formed from the freezing of raindrops or the refreezing of largely melted snowflakes when falling though a below-freezing layer of air near the earth's surface; 2) small hail, generally translucent particles, consisting of snow pellets (white, opaque, approximately round ice particles having a snowlike structure, and about 2 - 5 mm in diameter) encased in a thin layer of ice. The ice layer may form either by the accretion of droplets upon the snow pellet or by the melting and refreezing of the surface of the snow pellet (AMS). The estimated depth of frozen rain or ice pellets (water equivalent) that accumulated over a fixed period of time (accumulation period). The accumulation period is the same regardless of the forecast period. (When the accumulation period ends, a snap-shot is taken (grid made), and then the accumulation is set to zero (the bucket tip). The accumulation begins again for the next accumulation period.) The accumulation period and the bucket tip are exactly the same for each grid. Grids are available at forecast hours that are multiples of the accumulation period. FOR COAMPS the accumulation is over six hours.

entry.name: ocn_heat_cntnt
entry.description: The vertically integrated heat content of the ocean above the reference isotherm (26 deg C).

entry.name: geop_ht_ens_stdev
entry.description: The standard deviation of the geopotential height of the ensemble members for a point in time.

entry.name: prob_sig_wav_ht_gt12ft
entry.description: The probability that the significant wave height of ocean waves will be greater than 12 ft.

entry.name: prob_sig_wav_ht_gt18ft
entry.description: The probability that the significant wave height of ocean waves will be greater than 18 ft.

entry.name: evap_duct_ht
entry.description: The estimated height of a duct formed from evaporation of seawater which begins at sea level and rises to an elevation (duct height) corresponding to a change in the slope in the index of refraction.

entry.name: peak_wav_per_ens_stdev
entry.description: The standard deviation of the peak wave period of the ensemble members for a point in time.

entry.name: pres_ens_stdev
entry.description: The standard deviation of the pressure of the ensemble members for a point in time.

entry.name: sig_wav_ht_ens_stdev
entry.description: The standard deviation of the significant wave height of the ensemble members for a point in time.

entry.name: swl_wav_ht_ens_stdev
entry.description: The standard deviation of the swell wave height of the ensemble members for a point in time.

entry.name: aero_optdep
entry.description: The optical thickness measured vertically above some given altitude due to the extinction by aerosol particles.

entry.name: aero_extinct_part
entry.description: A coded long integer representing the proportions of sulfate and dust and smoke extinction in the layer.

entry.name: ozone_mix_ratio
entry.description: The ratio of the mass of a variable atmospheric constituent (here ozone) to the mass of dry air.

entry.name: aero_extinct_uv
entry.description: The removal by aerosol particles of long infrared radiant energy from an incident beam by the process of absorption and scattering.

entry.name: aero_extinct_vis
entry.description: The removal by aerosol particles of long infrared radiant energy from an incident beam by the process of absorption and scattering.

entry.name: aero_extinct_nir
entry.description: The removal by aerosol particles of long infrared radiant energy from an incident beam by the process of absorption and scattering.

entry.name: ttl_prcp_ens_stdev
entry.description: The standard deviation of the total precipitation of the ensemble members for a point in time.

entry.name: aero_extinct_mw
entry.description: The removal by aerosol particles of long infrared radiant energy from an incident beam by the process of absorption and scattering.

entry.name: aero_extinct_lw
entry.description: The removal by aerosol particles of long infrared radiant energy from an incident beam by the process of absorption and scattering.

entry.name: aero_asym_uv
entry.description: Asymmetry parameter (or asymmetry factor) in each layer at ultraviolet wavelengths. (Asymmetry factor is a fundamental property of a scattering medium that affects the transfer of radiant energy)

entry.name: aero_asym_vis
entry.description: Asymmetry parameter (or asymmetry factor) in each layer at visible wavelengths. (Asymmetry factor is a fundamental property of a scattering medium that affects the transfer of radiant energy)

entry.name: aero_asym_nir
entry.description: Asymmetry parameter (or asymmetry factor) in each layer at near infrared wavelengths. (Asymmetry factor is a fundamental property of a scattering medium that affects the transfer of radiant energy)

entry.name: aero_asym_mw
entry.description: Asymmetry parameter (or asymmetry factor) in each layer at mid infrared wavelengths. (Asymmetry factor is a fundamental property of a scattering medium that affects the transfer of radiant energy)

entry.name: aero_asym_lw
entry.description: Asymmetry parameter (or asymmetry factor) in each layer at long infrared wavelengths. (Asymmetry factor is a fundamental property of a scattering medium that affects the transfer of radiant energy)

entry.name: aero_scatter_uv
entry.description: A measure of the extinction due to scattering of ultraviolet radiation as it traverses a medium containing scattering particles (scattering coefficient).

entry.name: aero_scatter_vis
entry.description: A measure of the extinction due to scattering of visible radiation as it traverses a medium containing scattering particles (scattering coefficient).

entry.name: aero_scatter_nir
entry.description: A measure of the extinction due to scattering of near infrared radiation as it traverses a medium containing scattering particles (scattering coefficient).

entry.name: aero_optdep_sm
entry.description: The optical thickness measured vertically above some given altitude due to the extinction and scattering by smoke particles (integrated).

entry.name: aero_optdep_su
entry.description: The optical thickness measured vertically above some given altitude due to the extinction and scattering by sulfate aerosols (integrated).

entry.name: aero_optdep_sa
entry.description: The optical thickness measured vertically above some given altitude due to the extinction and scattering by salt particles (integrated).

entry.name: aero_optdep_du
entry.description: The optical thickness measured vertically above some given altitude due to the extinction and scattering by dust particles (integrated).

entry.name: temp_grad
entry.description: The rate of variation in temperature in a medium (salt water) over a specified distance (ocean surface to bottom).

entry.name: freezing_rain
entry.description: The estimated depth of mixed sleet (rain and snow) or rain (falls in liquid form) that freezes upon impact to form a coating of glaze upon the ground and on exposed objects (AMS Glossary, water equivalent) that accumulated over a fixed period of time (accumulation period). The accumulation period is the same regardless of the forecast period. (When the accumulation period ends, a snap-shot is taken (grid made), and then the accumulation is set to zero (the bucket tip). The accumulation begins again for the next accumulation period.) The accumulation period and the bucket tip are exactly the same for each grid. Grids are available at forecast hours that are multiples of the accumulation period.

entry.name: peak_wav_dir
entry.description: The angle measured clockwise from true north to the direction from which the peak waves are coming.

entry.name: peak_wav_per
entry.description: The quantity of time required for two successive peak wave crests to pass a fixed point.

entry.name: shrt_wav
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: rsdl_wav
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: lng_wav
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: mag_ditch_hdg
entry.description: The estimated angle, in a clockwise direction, between true north and the recommended direction of ditching an aircraft in a body of water.

entry.name: wnd_ucmp_mn
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: wnd_vcmp_mn
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: wnd_dif_ucmp_mn
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: wnd_dif_vcmp_mn
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: grnd_wet
entry.description: The estimated rate of ground coverage that is determined to be wet as compared to the entire surface.

entry.name: pres_err
entry.description: The quantity of error in the estimated air pressure.

entry.name: max_wav_ht
entry.description: The mean height of the highest one tenth of the waves measured from trough to crest.

entry.name: snsb_ltnt_heat_flux
entry.description: The rate of transfer of sensible heat (enthalphy) plus latent heat from one region to another.

entry.name: ttl_heat_flux
entry.description: The estimated total rate of flow of heat in the atmosphere.

entry.name: geop_ht_err
entry.description: The geopotential height of level or surface error estimate.

entry.name: frnt_anal
entry.description: The estimated rate of the psychometric parameters indicating the presence of a frontal boundary.

entry.name: fog
entry.description: The rate of probability of the occurrence of fog.

entry.name: rltv_hum_err
entry.description: The quantity of error in the estimated ratio of measured vapor pressure to the computed saturation vapor pressure at the temperature of the measurement.

entry.name: wnd_ucmp_err
entry.description: Wind u component (east-west) error estimate.

entry.name: wnd_vcmp_err
entry.description: Wind v component (north-south) error estimate.

entry.name: wnd_spd_ens_stdev
entry.description: The standard deviation of the wind speed of the ensemble members for a point in time.

entry.name: frz_ht
entry.description: The vertical dimension above a vertical reference data where the air temperature is 0 degrees Celsius.

entry.name: air_temp_err
entry.description: Analysis air temperature error from truth (observations).

entry.name: sea_sfc_ht_corr
entry.description: The sea height anomaly about a long term sea height mean.

entry.name: ceil_ht
entry.description: The height above ground level (AGL) of the lowest cloud or obscuring phenomena layer aloft with 5/8 or more summation total sky cover, which may be predominantly opaque, or the visibility into a surfaced-based obscuration.

entry.name: wnd_strs
entry.description: The drag force per unit area caused by the wind shear.

entry.name: snw_age
entry.description: The time difference between the data analysis and the date of the last measurable snow fall.

entry.name: terr_ht
entry.description: no definition available

entry.name: latitude
entry.description: Angular distance north or south from the earth's equator measure through 90 degrees. (Webster 1983)

entry.name: longitude
entry.description: The arc or portion of the earth's equator intersected between the meridian of a given place and the prime meridian (as from Greenwich, England) and expressed either in degrees or time. (Webster 1983)

entry.name: cld_top
entry.description: The estimated height of the upper surface of a cloud layer, ice or liquid.

entry.name: sea_temp_anom
entry.description: The difference between sea temperature analysis values and climatology.

entry.name: stab_cld
entry.description: The estimated rate of the sky dome that is covered by non-convective or stable clouds.

entry.name: lift_cdns_lvl
entry.description: The level at which a parcel of moist air lifted dry-adiabatically would become saturated.

entry.name: thkn
entry.description: The geometric thickness of layer.

entry.name: peak_wnd_spd
entry.description: The highest instantaneous wind speed during a specified time period.

entry.name: cld_wtr_dnst
entry.description: The density of condensed liquid cloud water at a given level.

entry.name: cld_ice_dnst
entry.description: The density of condensed frozen cloud water.

entry.name: wnd_utru
entry.description: The east-west wind component based on true east. (correct for lambert conformal projection)

entry.name: wnd_vtru
entry.description: The north-south wind component based on true north (correction for lambert conformal projection).

entry.name: ustar
entry.description: Motion near the surface where the shearing stress is often assumed to be independent of height and approximately proportional to the square of the mean velocity. The friction velocity is, therefore, exactly the velocity for which this square law would be valid.
